Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
The Portfolio class manages a collection of stocks and mutual funds. It allows users to buy, sell, update prices, calculate total gain, and search for investments. This class contains the main method and various helper methods to manage the portfolio.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Portfolio()
    Constructs a new empty portfolio with no stocks or mutual funds.

  • Constructor Details

    • Portfolio

      public Portfolio()
      Constructs a new empty portfolio with no stocks or mutual funds. Initializes the investments list and keyword index.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method that runs the portfolio management program. It continuously asks the user for input and performs actions like buying, selling, and updating investments.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments, where the first argument is the filename containing investment data.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(String fileName)
      Saves all investments in the portfolio to the specified file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to save the investments.

    • readFile

      public void readFile(String fileName)
      Reads the investment data from the specified file and populates the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to read investments from.

    • buyInvestment

      public void buyInvestment(Scanner scanner, String fileName)
      Buys a new investment or adds shares to an existing one.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner for user input.
      filename - The name of the file to save after buying the investment.

    • sellInvestment

      public void sellInvestment(Scanner scanner)
      Sells an investment and updates the portfolio accordingly.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner for user input.

    • updateAllPrices

      public void updateAllPrices(Scanner scanner)
      Updates the prices of all investments in the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner for user input.

    • totalGain

      public void totalGain()
      Calculates and displays the total gain of the portfolio by summing the gains of all investments.

    • searchInvestments

      public void searchInvestments(String symbol, String[] keywords, double lowerBound, double upperBound)
      Searches for investments in the portfolio based on symbol, name keywords, and price range. hashmap index
      Parameters:
      symbol - The investment symbol to search for (can be empty for no symbol search).
      keywords - The list of keywords to search for in the investment name (can be empty for no name search).
      lowerBound - The lower bound of the price range (use Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY for no lower bound).
      upperBound - The upper bound of the price range (use Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY for no upper bound).

    • addToIndex

      public void addToIndex(String name, int position)
      Adds an investment to the keyword index based on the investment's name. The name is split into keywords (lowercased) and each keyword is indexed with the position of the investment.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the investment to index.
      position - The position of the investment in the investments list.

    • addInvestment

      public void addInvestment(Investment investment)
      Adds a new investment to the portfolio and updates the keyword index. The investment is added to the investments list, and its name is indexed.
      Parameters:
      investment - The investment to be added.

    • deleteInvestment

      public void deleteInvestment(int position)
      Deletes an investment from the portfolio and removes it from the keyword index. The specified investment is removed from the investments list, and its name is unindexed. After removal, positions in the index are adjusted to account for the change in list size.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the investment to be deleted in the investments list.

    • removeFromIndex

      public void removeFromIndex(String name, int position)
      Removes an investment from the keyword index based on the investment's name and position. The name is split into keywords (lowercased), and the specific position is removed from each keyword's index. If a keyword has no more positions, it is removed from the index.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the investment to remove from the index.
      position - The position of the investment to be removed from the index.
